channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: First Patient Begins Sickle Cell Gene Therapy That F.D.A. Approved
item.description: A 12-year-old boy in the Washington, D.C., area faces months of procedures to remedy his disease. “I want to be cured,” he said.

item.title: Palestinians React After Israel Orders Evacuations in Rafah
item.description: The Israeli military began warning more than 100,000 people in eastern Rafah to evacuate, signaling that it was moving closer to invading the southernmost Gazan city.

item.title: Howard Schultz urges Starbucks to 'fix' U.S. stores after big earnings miss
item.description: “The company’s fix needs to begin at home:”

item.title: Russia to Hold Drills on Tactical Nuclear Weapons in New Tensions With West
item.description: Russian officials claimed the order was in response to comments from the West about the possibility of more direct involvement in Ukraine. NATO called Russia’s announcement “irresponsible.”

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Military Warns More Than 100,000 People in Rafah to Evacuate
item.description: Israel wants to “move people out of harm’s way,” a military official said, a sign that it may be inching closer to invading the Gazan city in defiance of international pressure.

item.title: Cesar Luis Menotti, the ‘thin one’ who led Argentina to its first World Cup in 1978, has died at 85
item.description: The longtime smoker once talked of meeting the great writer Jorge Luis Borges: "When I asked him if it bothered him that I smoked, he told me: ‘What intoxicates me is not the cigarette, but the stupid conversations.’”

item.title: Study Suggests Genetics as a Cause, Not Just a Risk, for Some Alzheimers
item.description: People with two copies of the gene variant APOE4 are almost certain to get Alzheimer’s, say researchers, who proposed a framework under which such patients could be diagnosed years before symptoms.

item.title: Russia to Hold Drills on Tactical Nuclear Weapons in New Tensions With West
item.description: Russian officials claimed the order was in response to comments from the West about the possibility of more direct involvement in Ukraine. NATO called Russia’s announcement “irresponsible.”

item.title: Columbia cancels university-wide commencement amid protests but will hold smaller ceremonies 5 miles away from the main campus
item.description: “Our students emphasized that these smaller-scale, school-based celebrations are most meaningful to them and their families."

item.title: Judge Finds Trump in Contempt Again and Threatens Jail Time
item.description: Donald J. Trump again broke a gag order meant to bar him from attacking participants in his criminal trial, Justice Juan M. Merchan ruled. He threatened the former president with jail.

item.title: Are Flight Offsets Worth It?
item.description: A lot of them don’t work and some might even be harmful. But there are things you can do if you really have to fly.

item.title: Kim Godwin, first Black female network news chief, leaves ABC News
item.description: After working at ABC, CBS and NBC, Godwin said she's quitting the business. “I leave with my head held high and wish the entire team continued success."

item.title: Greg Lukianoff Is Getting Back to the Basics on Free Speech on Campus
item.description: Amid campus protests and the Trump years, free speech debates are charged. Jane Coaston interviews Greg Lukianoff about getting back to basics on the First Amendment.

item.title: Inquiry Into Johannesburg Fire Blames City Officials for Deadly Conditions
item.description: Although a resident confessed to setting the August 2023 blaze that killed 76 people in a dilapidated building, a report found that officials had ignored warning signs for years.

item.title: Tesla may charge Model Y owners to unlock the full potential of their batteries
item.description: That could bump the cost up another $2,000
